title: Print numbers from 1 to n
contentHtml:
Write a program to print numbers from 1 to n

Input  : 5
Output : 1 2 3 4 5

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main()
{
    int number, i;
    printf("Input: ");
    scanf("%d", &number);
    for (i = 1; i <= number; ++i)
    {
        printf("%d", i);
    }
    return 0;
}

// Programme to print numbers from 1 to N
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
#define ll long long // for typing ease;
using namespace std;
int main(){
    // Taking user input
    cout<<"Enter N: ";
    ll n;   cin>>n;
    
    //printing numbers from 1 to N;
    cout<<"Printing numbers from 1 to "<<n<<"..."<<endl;
    for(int i=1;i<=n;i++){
        cout<<i<<" ";
    }

    return 0;
}

/*
Author : Kartikeya Saini
*/

using System;

class Program
{
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        Console.Write("Input the value for N: ");
        int n = int.Parse(Console.ReadLine());

        Console.WriteLine("Output:");
        for (int x = 1; x <= n; x++)
        {
            Console.Write(x + ", ");
        }
    }
}

import java.util.Scanner;

public class PrintNumbersFrom1ToN{
    public static void main(String[] args) {
       Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
       System.out.print("Enter the number: ");
       int n = sc.nextInt();
       print1ToN(n);
  }
  static void print1ToN(int n){
    for(int i = 1; i <=n; i++){
      System.out.print(i + " ");
    }
  }
}

let num=prompt("enter a number")
for(let i=0;i<num;i++)
{
    console.log(i+1);
}

fun main() {
  print("Enter number : ")
  println()
  var input = readLine()
  for (i in 1..input!!.toInt()) {
    println(i)
  }
}

print 'Enter a number : '
input = gets.to_i
(1..input).each { |n| puts n }

const print1ToN = (num: number): number => {
  for(i=0;i<num; i++){
   console.log(i+1);
  }
}

print1ToN(5)

fun main() {
  print("Enter number : ")
  println()
  var input = readLine()
  for (i in 1..input!!.toInt()) {
    println(i)
  }
}

print("Input the value for N:", end=" ")
n = int(input())

print("Output:")
for x, number in enumerate(range(1, n + 1)):
    print(number, end=", ")

import scala.io.StdIn._;

object print1ToN {
    def main(args:Array[String]):Unit={
        println("Enter a number : ");
        var n = readLine().toInt;
        var cnt:Int=0;
        
        cnt=1;
        while(cnt<=n)
        {
            printf("%d ",cnt);
            cnt=cnt+1;
        }
    }
}

package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
	var num int
	fmt.Scanf("%d", &num)
	for i := 1; i <= num; i++ {
		fmt.Print(i, " ")
	}
}

main :: IO()
main = do
    let n = 5
    putStrLn . unwords . map show $ [1 .. n]

<?php
$input = (int)readline('Enter an integer: ');
function one2N($n) {
 for($i=1; $i<=$n; $i++){
    echo $i." ";
 }
}

one2N($input)
?>

sub print1ToN {
for ($count = 1 ; $count <= $_[0] ; $count++)
{
    print $count."\n";
   
}
}
print1ToN(5);

fn print_numbers(n: u32) {
    for i in 1..=n {
        println!("{}", i);
    }
}
